messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: from Pris, who'z waving *WILDLY* @ Bonnie, too!!! :D
messages.msgSnippet: Waving back and big congratulations on the new grandbaby.  Looking forward to that picture :) Bonnie ...
messages.messageBody:
Waving back and big congratulations on the new grandbaby. Looking forward
to that picture :)

Bonnie


>From: x_t_sipr@...

>Bonnie, too!!! :D
>Date: Wed, 25 Apr 2001 02:50:46 -0000
>
>Hiiiiiiiiii Bonnie :))
>
>yes, yes, I remember you, too!!! goodness, I'm *so* flattered,
>goodness, it's nice meeting up w/ old friends again, I've missed
>ya'll so much!!! ... and *yes*, dh is a train engineer and, he's
>great, too, thanks for asking :)
>
>since Sept, I've had to *severely* limit my online time (just
>reading/not posting) b/c we've spent LOTS of time on the road
>visiting our newest love, our 1st grandbaby (NO, I'm NOT OLD, @ least
>that's what I keep telling myself!!! no haha's!) ... ohhhhhh, I
>wished I could e-m pictures of Kinsey (7 mths old) but I can't since
>the attachments have been disabled (which, btw, I think was *very*
>necessary) ... soooooo, I guess ya'll will just have to trust me when
>I say, she's just *GORGEOUS*, just like her sweet mama ... of course,
>ya knew I'd say that, right??? just a *glowing* Gramby and
>ahhhhhhhhh, life is *GRAND* in south Tx :D
>
>*ack*, poor, poor Linda S. Davis, bless her heart ... I HOPE she's
>able to get rid of that nasty worm and return soon??? poor thing >:I
>
>leaping off for the moment ...
>Pris in TX (dss 12/10)
>
>~*~*~*~*~
>If we all did things we are capable of doing, we would literally
>astound ourselves ... Thomas Alva Edison
>
> \\\\\/////
> ( @ @ )
> ---oOOo--(_)--oOOo---

messages.subject: Re: from Pris, who'z waving *WILDLY* @ Bonnie, too!!! :D
messages.msgSnippet: Hiiiiiiiiii Bonnie :)) yes, yes, I remember you, too!!!  goodness, I m *so* flattered, goodness, it s nice meeting up w/ old friends again, I ve missed ya ll
messages.messageBody:
Hiiiiiiiiii Bonnie :))

yes, yes, I remember you, too!!! goodness, I'm *so* flattered,
goodness, it's nice meeting up w/ old friends again, I've missed
ya'll so much!!! ... and *yes*, dh is a train engineer and, he's
great, too, thanks for asking :)

since Sept, I've had to *severely* limit my online time (just
reading/not posting) b/c we've spent LOTS of time on the road
visiting our newest love, our 1st grandbaby (NO, I'm NOT OLD, @ least
that's what I keep telling myself!!! no haha's!) ... ohhhhhh, I
wished I could e-m pictures of Kinsey (7 mths old) but I can't since
the attachments have been disabled (which, btw, I think was *very*
necessary) ... soooooo, I guess ya'll will just have to trust me when
I say, she's just *GORGEOUS*, just like her sweet mama ... of course,
ya knew I'd say that, right??? just a *glowing* Gramby and
ahhhhhhhhh, life is *GRAND* in south Tx :D

*ack*, poor, poor Linda S. Davis, bless her heart ... I HOPE she's
able to get rid of that nasty worm and return soon??? poor thing >:I

leaping off for the moment ...
Pris in TX (dss 12/10)

~*~*~*~*~
If we all did things we are capable of doing, we would literally
astound ourselves ... Thomas Alva Edison

\\\\\/////
( @ @ )
---oOOo--(_)--oOOo---
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., "Bonnie Painter" <bonniepainter@h...>
wrote:
> I remember you too Pris! Was wondering where you've been. How is
your
> hubby, the train engineer?? (see, I really do remember you)
>
> Bonnie

messages.messageBody:

hubby, the train engineer?? (see, I really do remember you)

Bonnie
